Package arcade.env.comp

Class Diffuser

java.lang.Object
arcade.env.comp.Diffuser
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component, java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable
Direct Known Subclasses:
TriDiffuser
public abstract class Diffuser
extends java.lang.Object
implements Component
Implementation of Component for diffusion.

Diffuser calculates diffusion of concentrations using finite difference approximation. The calculation is repeated per second (model tick is one minute). Methods are written to work regardless of underlying geometry. Methods extending Diffuser for a specific geometry will need to adjust the multipliers for both the finite difference approximation and the pseudo-steady state approximation.

Since:
2.2
Version:
2.3.9
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Diffuser

      Diffuser​(Simulation sim, Lattice lat, int code)
      Creates a Diffuser for the given molecule.

      Diffusion parameters are pulled based on the molecule code. Six border arrays are used to check if an index is located at the right/left (LENGTH, x axis), top/bottom (WIDTH, y axis), and up/down (DEPTH, z axis) directions.

      Parameters:
      sim - the simulation instance
      lat - the lattice of concentrations to be diffused
      code - the molecule code
